member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.AesCryptoServiceProvider
member.summary: Performs symmetric encryption and decryption using the Cryptographic Application Programming Interfaces (CAPI) implementation of the Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) algorithm.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.exception: There is no supported key size for the current platform.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.AesCryptoServiceProvider.CreateDecryptor
member.summary: Creates a symmetric AES decryptor object using the current key and initialization vector (IV).
member.returns: A symmetric AES decryptor object.
member.exception: The current key is invalid or missing.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.AesCryptoServiceProvider.CreateDecryptor(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a symmetric AES decryptor object using the specified key and initialization vector (IV).
member.returns: A symmetric AES decryptor object.
member.exception: key or iv is .
key is invalid.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.AesCryptoServiceProvider.CreateEncryptor
member.summary: Creates a symmetric AES encryptor object using the current key and initialization vector (IV).
member.returns: A symmetric AES encryptor object.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.AesCryptoServiceProvider.CreateEncryptor(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a symmetric encryptor object using the specified key and initialization vector (IV).
member.returns: A symmetric AES encryptor object.
member.exception: The key or iv parameter is .
key is invalid.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.AesCryptoServiceProvider.GenerateIV
member.summary: Generates a random initialization vector (IV) to use for the algorithm.
member.exception: The initialization vector (IV) could not be generated.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.AesCryptoServiceProvider.GenerateKey
member.summary: Generates a random key to use for the algorithm.
member.exception: The key could not be generated.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.AesCryptoServiceProvider.Key
member.summary: Gets or sets the symmetric key that is used for encryption and decryption.
member.returns: The symmetric key that is used for encryption and decryption.
member.exception: The value for the key is .
The size of the key is invalid.

member.name: P:System.Security.Cryptography.AesCryptoServiceProvider.KeySize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size, in bits, of the secret key.
member.returns: The size, in bits, of the key.

member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDESCryptoServiceProvider
member.summary: Defines a wrapper object to access the cryptographic service provider (CSP) version of the algorithm. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDESCryptoServiceProvider.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.exception: The cryptographic service provider is not available.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDESCryptoServiceProvider.CreateDecryptor(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a symmetric decryptor object with the specified key () and initialization vector ().
member.param: The secret key to use for the symmetric algorithm.
The initialization vector to use for the symmetric algorithm.
member.returns: A symmetric decryptor object.
member.exception: The value of the property is . -or- The value of the property is and the value of the property is not 8. -or- An invalid key size was used. -or- The algorithm key size was not available.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDESCryptoServiceProvider.CreateEncryptor(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a symmetric encryptor object with the specified key () and initialization vector ().
member.param: The secret key to use for the symmetric algorithm.

The initialization vector to use for the symmetric algorithm.
The initialization vector must be 8 bytes long. If it is longer than 8 bytes, it is truncated and an exception is not thrown. Before you call , check the length of the initialization vector and throw an exception if it is too long.
member.returns: A symmetric encryptor object.
member.exception: The value of the property is . -or- The value of the property is and the value of the property is not 8. -or- An invalid key size was used. -or- The algorithm key size was not available.

member.summary: Generates a random initialization vector () to use for the algorithm.

member.summary: Generates a random to be used for the algorithm.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.RSACryptoServiceProvider.Decrypt(System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Decrypts data with the algorithm.
member.param: The data to be decrypted.
to perform direct decryption using OAEP padding (only available on a computer running Microsoft Windows XP or later); otherwise, to use PKCS#1 v1.5 padding.
member.returns: The decrypted data, which is the original plain text before encryption.
member.exception: The cryptographic service provider (CSP) cannot be acquired. -or- The fOAEP parameter is and the length of the rgb parameter is greater than . -or- The fOAEP parameter is and OAEP is not supported. -or- The key does not match the encrypted data. However, the exception wording may not be accurate. For example, it may say Not enough storage is available to process this command.
rgb is .

The padding.
member.returns: The decrypted data.
member.exception: data is . -or- padding is .
The padding mode is not supported.

member.summary: Encrypts data with the algorithm.

to perform direct encryption using OAEP padding (only available on a computer running Windows XP or later); otherwise, to use PKCS#1 v1.5 padding.
member.returns: The encrypted data.
member.exception: The cryptographic service provider (CSP) cannot be acquired. -or- The length of the rgb parameter is greater than the maximum allowed length. -or- The fOAEP parameter is and OAEP padding is not supported.
rgb is .

member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.CspProviderFlags
member.summary: Specifies flags that modify the behavior of the cryptographic service providers (CSP).

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.CspProviderFlags.CreateEphemeralKey
member.summary: Create a temporary key that is released when the associated Rivest-Shamir-Adleman (RSA) object is closed. Do not use this flag if you want your key to be independent of the RSA object.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.CspProviderFlags.NoFlags
member.summary: Do not specify any settings.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.CspProviderFlags.NoPrompt
member.summary: Prevent the CSP from displaying any user interface (UI) for this context.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.CspProviderFlags.UseArchivableKey
member.summary: Allow a key to be exported for archival or recovery.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.CspProviderFlags.UseDefaultKeyContainer
member.summary: Use key information from the default key container.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.CspProviderFlags.UseExistingKey
member.summary: Use key information from the current key.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.CspProviderFlags.UseMachineKeyStore
member.summary: Use key information from the computer's key store.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.CspProviderFlags.UseNonExportableKey
member.summary: Use key information that cannot be exported.

member.name: F:System.Security.Cryptography.CspProviderFlags.UseUserProtectedKey
member.summary: Notify the user through a dialog box or another method when certain actions are attempting to use a key. This flag is not compatible with the flag.
